[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Watershed Management Water Use Tracking (WUT) system defines requirements for tracking and managing water use data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: WUT supports efficient tracking and analysis of water use through GIS and database integration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: WUT integrates with IBM DB2, ArcSDE, and external monitoring systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: WUT provides web dashboards for internal and external users.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: WUT supports deployment on desktops, web servers, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: WUT interacts with ArcGIS and SQL databases for data access and manipulation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: WUT ensures secure data communication using HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: WUT is optimized for efficient memory usage with large datasets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: WUT operates continuously with periodic maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: WUT is customizable for various workflows and regulatory requirements.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: WUT integrates with GIS and external monitoring services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: WUT supports data entry, integration, reporting, and water use tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: WUT is designed for technical staff, water resource managers, and regulatory agencies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: WUT relies on existing GIS and database infrastructure for analysis.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: WUT assumes the availability of relational database systems and GIS for data synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Actor: Any user or system interacting with Watershed Management Water Use Tracking (WUT).

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with GIS and RDB for data access and manipulation (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support data export to CSV and other formats for reports (REQ-FUNC-53).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable data entry and modification of water use permits (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate reports on water usage trends and water quality (REQ-DB-15).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide exportable reports in multiple formats (REQ-INTF-32).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The interface shall support multiple languages for use in international regions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall support 1,000 concurrent users without degrading performance, ensuring optimal user experience during peak load times.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store water use data in a secure, relational database (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use modular architecture for scalability and ease of maintenance.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 for security management.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall adhere to WCAG 2.1 for accessibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically based on user load, with automatic resource allocation to handle increased demand.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional and performance tests will be conducted to validate the integration, data consistency, and generation of reports across modules.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System guides, troubleshooting manuals, and training resources.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 27001 standards, WCAG 2.1 accessibility guidelines, and ArcGIS API documentation.
